hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X, and today, we will work on compassion for around 15 minutes.

We’ll be exploring how to cultivate greater self-compassion for ourselves.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. Now, X would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Tap play to start the audio exercise

content.heading: Reflection
content.text: You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own.

How was that experience for you? 

What would the benefit of practicing self-compassion be for you? 

How might you take one or more of these reflections and integrate them into your life? 

How could these practices/reflections be applied to how you relate, think about, and interact with others?
content.heading: Reflection

hostNotes.text:
Now we’ll take 1 minutes to reflect on our own. 

How was that experience for you? What would the benefit of practicing self-compassion be for you? How might you take one or more of these reflections and integrate them into your life? How could these practices/reflections be applied to how you relate, think about, and interact with others?

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now. 

> Press play to start the timer. 

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: What would the benefit of self-compassion be for you?
How might you integrate self compassion into your life?
How could self compassion impact how you relate to others?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. Today, we’ve explored self-compassion.

A high number of children and adults struggle with anxiety, and self-esteem and self-worth. The expectations of society compound this and can be internalized in unhealthy ways. It is, therefore, especially important to practice self-compassion.

Self-compassion can provide us with a route to soften (or alleviate) our internal self-critic, cultivate forgiveness for ourselves and treat ourselves with the tenderness and nurturing kindness we need and deserve.
If we're up for it, we can continue with a mission: Practice self-compassion once a day when we fail, or something doesn’t go as planned over the next three days.

Plan the steps you will take by considering what you need to practice to implement self-compassion. Before we leave this space, let’s do a mini check-out: How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two to three words.

Who would like to start? > Let everyone in the session check out one by one. Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today. > Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done. Today, we’ve explored self-compassion.

A high number of children and adults struggle with anxiety, and self-esteem and self-worth. The expectations of society compound this and can be internalized in unhealthy ways. It is, therefore, especially important to practice self-compassion.
content.heading: Compassion

content.text: Self-compassion can provide us with a route to soften (or alleviate) our internal self-critic, cultivate forgiveness for ourselves and treat ourselves with the tenderness and nurturing kindness we need and deserve.
content.heading: Compassion

content.text:
If we're up for it, we can continue with a mission: Practice self-compassion once a day when we fail, or something doesn’t go as planned over the next three days.

Plan the steps you will take by considering what you need to practice to implement self-compassion.
content.heading: Compassion

en.name: Self Compassion

hostNotes.text: > Press play to start the exercise

en.description: Sometimes, it can be challenging at first to offer the same compassionate response to ourselves as we do to our friends. Self-compassion is when we show kindness and compassion to ourselves in the same way we do for others.
